meanings.definition: Capable of being relaxed or made less tense.
meanings.sent1: After a long day, the soft music made the atmosphere more relaxable.
meanings.sent2: The cozy blanket was so relaxable that it helped me unwind after work.
meanings.sent3: The cat found the warm sunbeam on the carpet to be the most relaxable spot in the house.
meanings.sent4: The gentle breeze through the open window created a relaxable environment in the room.
meanings.sent5: The soothing scent of lavender made the room feel relaxable and peaceful.

meanings.definition: Able to be loosened or made less strict.
meanings.sent1: The tight knot in the rope was not relaxable, no matter how hard I pulled.
meanings.sent2: The rules at the park were relaxable, allowing children to play freely.
meanings.sent3: The strict teacher tried to be relaxable during the outdoor class.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room was so thick that it felt like it needed a relaxable release.
meanings.sent5: The grip on the jar lid was finally relaxable after running it under hot water.
